MVDataset

class mvdatasets.mvdataset.MVDataset(dataset_name: str, scene_name: str, datasets_path: Path, splits: list, point_clouds_paths: list = [], config: dict = {}, pose_only: bool = False, verbose: bool = False)

Any dataset container. All data is stored in CPU memory.

get_foreground_radius() → float
get_frame_rate() → float
get_height(split: str = 'train', camera_idx: int = 0) → int

Returns the height of a camera

Parameters:

  • split (str, optional) – Defaults to “train”.

  • camera_idx (int, optional) – Defaults to 0.

Returns:

height

Return type:

int

get_nr_per_camera_frames() → int

Returns the sequence length of the dataset

get_nr_sequence_frames() → int

Returns the sequence length of the dataset

get_resolution(split='train', camera_idx=0) → tuple

Returns the resolution (width, height) of a camera

Parameters:

  • split (str, optional) – Defaults to “train”.

  • camera_idx (int, optional) – Defaults to 0.

Returns:

width, height

Return type:

(int, int)

get_scene_radius() → float
get_scene_type() → str
get_sphere_init_radius() → float
get_split(split: str) → List[Camera]

Returns the list of cameras for a split

get_split_modalities(split: str) → List[str]

Returns the list of modalities for a split

get_splits() → List[str]

Returns the list of splits

get_width(split: str = 'train', camera_idx: int = 0) → int

Returns the width of a camera

Parameters:

  • split (str, optional) – Defaults to “train”.

  • camera_idx (int, optional) – Defaults to 0.

Returns:

width

Return type:

int
